intro: Verbesina pennellii, commonly known as the Mexican ironweed, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and showy blooms. The plant typically grows as an erect annual or biennial herb, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in dense, spherical clusters. Verbesina pennellii is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in a variety of soil conditions.
